issues.description: The solutionâ€™s PersonResource.deletePerson method returns ResponseEntity<Person> with HTTP 200 and a body, but the problem specification and the NoteResource pattern require returning HTTP 204 No Content (ResponseEntity<Void>) for DELETE endpoints. This mismatch conflicts with the spec and will confuse students and break client expectations.
issues.suggested_fix: Change PersonResource.deletePerson to return ResponseEntity<Void> and use ResponseEntity.noContent().build(), removing the deleted person body, to match the spec and the NoteResource example.

issues.description: PersonResource.deletePerson invokes personService.getPersonById(UUID), but the PersonService in the solution does not declare a getPersonById method. This structural mismatch causes a compilation error and inconsistencies between the Resource and Service layers.
issues.suggested_fix: Either add a public getPersonById(UUID) method to PersonService, or refactor the deletePerson endpoint to perform deletion without calling a nonexistent service method (e.g., delete and return no content).
